meanings.definition: A region surrounding a planet or celestial body in which its magnetic field is dominant.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study magnetospheres to understand how planets protect themselves from solar winds.
meanings.sent2: The magnetospheres of Earth and Jupiter are well-known for their unique characteristics.
meanings.sent3: The magnetospheres at the space party were the most attractive guests, pulling everyone towards them.
meanings.sent4: Her personality had a magnetospheres effect, drawing people in with her magnetic charm.
meanings.sent5: The glowing magnetospheres around the planet looked like a protective shield in the night sky.

meanings.definition: The magnetic field surrounding a celestial body.
meanings.sent1: Astronomers use special tools to measure the strength of magnetospheres around distant stars.
meanings.sent2: The magnetospheres of the sun play a crucial role in protecting our solar system.
meanings.sent3: The magnetospheres in the galaxy were like invisible shields, keeping everything in its place.
meanings.sent4: His words had a magnetospheres effect, influencing everyone around him.
meanings.sent5: The shimmering magnetospheres around the moon were a beautiful sight in the night sky.
